macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Ethereum Tests Resistance at $1,965 Amid Bearish Trend
items.summary: Ethereum is trading at $1,923 and attempting a bullish correction to test resistance near $1,965, but technical analysis suggests continued downward pressure with a potential target below $1,655 if support at $1,775 breaks.

items.title: Coinbase Reports Surprise Loss as Crypto Selloff Continues
items.summary: Cryptocurrency exchange Coinbase swung to a quarterly loss amid an ongoing flight from cryptocurrencies, though its stock bounced off a two-year low in after-hours trading as the company highlighted new features including prediction markets.

items.title: Standard Chartered Slashes Bitcoin Price Target by 50%
items.summary: Investment bank Standard Chartered lowered its cryptocurrency forecasts, expecting Bitcoin to fall toward $50,000 and Ether to bottom near $1,400, citing ETF dynamics and redemption risks as key drivers of ongoing weakness.

items.title: Bitcoin Down 29.9% in Past 30 Days Amid Market Correction
items.summary: Bitcoin has dropped 29.9% over the past month and is trading at $65,189.77, well below its October 2025 peak of $124,000, with the Crypto Fear & Greed Index at 5 signaling 'Extreme Fear.'

items.title: Trump Announces Crypto Policy at Forum in Florida
items.summary: Donald Trump delivered a highly anticipated announcement at the Trump Crypto Forum 2026 regarding cryptocurrency regulation and digital assets policy, signaling that crypto has become a political priority.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: Cloudflare Launches Markdown Conversion for AI Crawlers
items.summary: Cloudflare introduced a feature allowing websites to serve content in Markdown format instead of HTML to AI crawlers and agents, reducing computational costs for parsing. Publishers can enable this via the Accept header with text/markdown or robots.txt directives specifying AI usage permissions.

items.title: Ricoh Acquires ValueTech to Boost AI-Powered Process Automation
items.summary: Ricoh announced the acquisition of Chile-based ValueTech, enhancing its capabilities in AI, document management, predictive analytics, and process automation for regulated industries like healthcare and finance. The move supports Ricoh's strategy for intelligent workplaces in Latin America.

items.title: Cisco Projects Over $5 Billion in AI Infrastructure Orders for 2026
items.summary: Cisco reported $2.1 billion in AI infrastructure orders from hyperscalers in Q2 alone, expecting over $5 billion for fiscal 2026, driven by new switching silicon and AgenticOps for AI-driven network operations and security.

items.title: India Commits to Inclusive and Sovereign AI Development
items.summary: India's AI strategy will be inclusive by design, interoperable, and sovereign by capability, as stated by official Pradhan on February 13, 2026.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: Nintendo Announces February 2026 Switch 2 Game Lineup Including REANIMAL and Mario Tennis Fever
items.summary: Nintendo revealed upcoming titles for Switch 2 and Switch, with REANIMAL launching February 13, Mario Tennis Fever and Yakuza Kiwami 3 & Dark Ties on February 12, and others like DRAGON QUEST VII Reimagined already out on February 5.

items.title: PlayStation State of Play February 12 Delivers 60+ Minutes of Third-Party and Indie PS5 Announcements
items.summary: Sony's State of Play livestream on February 12 showcased third-party and indie games for PS5, including updates on Ka Scars of Cosmore, Legacy of Cain: Defiance remaster, Nava Prologue launching February 19, and Marathon server slam.

items.title: Konami's Silent Hill Transmission Follows State of Play with Series Updates
items.summary: Konami streamed Silent Hill Transmission on February 12 at 4 PM PT, providing latest updates on the Silent Hill series including Silent Hill: Townfall and potential news on the first game's remake.

items.title: Rayman: 30th Anniversary Edition Announced for Launch on February 13
items.summary: During PlayStation State of Play, Ubisoft revealed Rayman: 30th Anniversary Edition launching February 13, alongside a trailer for upcoming retro-inspired adventure Mina the Hollower.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: Tech Selloff Deepens Across Wall Street, Cisco Shares Plunge 11%
items.summary: Wall Street indexes fell sharply as investors sold off technology stocks amid concerns over high chip prices and profitability forecasts; Cisco suffered its worst decline in over two years after a weaker-than-expected profit outlook, while software firms like Atlassian and Adobe dropped over 2%.[1][2]

items.title: Global Tech Layoffs Surpass 30,000 in Early 2026
items.summary: Over 30,700 tech layoffs recorded worldwide in just over a month, with the US, Sweden, and Netherlands hardest hit; companies like Meta (1,000+ cuts in Reality Labs), Block (1,100 positions), Autodesk, and Salesforce each announced around 1,000 layoffs as part of restructuring efforts.[3]

items.title: Ricoh Acquires Chile's ValueTech to Boost Process Automation
items.summary: Ricoh announced the acquisition of ValueTech, a leader in digitalization and automation for processes and document management, to enhance its offerings in Latin America and support intelligent workplace transformations.[5]

items.title: Zebra Technologies Shares Surge 17% on Strong 2026 Forecast
items.summary: Zebra Tech stock jumped 17% after forecasting 2026 sales growth of 9-13%, above analyst estimates of 9.8%, and announcing a $1 billion stock buyback plan.[4]

items.title: PC Makers HP and Dell Drop After Lenovo's Chip Shortage Warning
items.summary: HP and Dell shares fell 6.4% and 9.2% respectively following Lenovo's warning of shipment pressures due to a memory-chip shortage; broader chip sector declines hit Intel, AMD, Marvell, and Broadcom.[2]

items.title: Equinix Shares Rise 11% on Strong Data Center Revenue Outlook
items.summary: Data center operator Equinix jumped 11% after forecasting annual revenue above estimates, driven by demand linked to data infrastructure needs.[2]
